title: Add thumbs up/down feedback to chat assistant with LangSmith integration
description: Add a thumbs-up / thumbs-down button to each AI assistant response in the chat window. When clicked, send the feedback (positive or negative) to LangSmith as a run score so we can track response quality over time. Requirements: - Render a thumb-up and thumb-down icon beside each assistant message - On click, submit feedback to LangSmith via the feedback API (run ID + score) - Visually indicate which button was selected - Allow the user to change their vote

title: Support multiple chat sessions with independent context
description: Support multiple independent chat sessions within the AI assistant panel. Requirements: - Allow users to create new chat sessions from the assistant UI - Allow users to switch between existing chat sessions - Allow users to delete previous chat sessions - Each chat session must maintain its own isolated conversation context (message history and any LLM context window state) - Persist sessions so they survive page reloads - Show a session list or sidebar with titles/timestamps for easy navigation

title: Fix resize handle oscillation and multi-select resize bugs in TransformHandles
description:
## Resize Bug Fix — Agent Handoff

### Problem
Resize handles on the CollabBoard whiteboard oscillate/flicker during drag and snap back to original size on release. User confirmed: "every other rendered frame snaps it back to its original space" — a repeating cycle until release, then it resets.

### Root Cause (Confirmed)
In TransformHandles.tsx, the delta calculation used hx/hy derived from the bounds prop, which re-renders on every frame during drag:

    const dx = node.x() - (hx - HANDLE_SIZE / 2);  // hx shifts every render!

1. Frame 1: hx at original -> dx = total displacement -> correct resize
2. Frame 2: bounds updated -> hx shifts -> dx ~ 0 -> snaps back to original
3. Frame 3: bounds reset -> hx shifts back -> dx correct again -> resize
4. Oscillation continues; on release, final dx is wrong -> snaps to original

### What Was Fixed
File: apps/web/src/modules/objects/ui/TransformHandles.tsx
- Added dragStartPosRef to capture handle position at drag start
- Changed onDragMove and onDragEnd to compute dx/dy from dragStartPosRef (fixed reference) instead of re-rendered hx/hy
- Fix is written, saved, HMR-confirmed, and USER-TESTED WORKING

### What Was NOT Fixed Yet
1. Multi-select proportional scaling (BoardPage.tsx:291-309) — uses selectionBounds from current render. Should work via incremental scaling but needs manual testing with 2+ selected objects.
2. No preview/commit separation — both onResize and onResizeEnd (BoardPage.tsx:638-639) fire the same handler that commits to store on every drag frame. Causes unnecessary Firestore writes. Future optimization.
3. Rotation handle may have a similar issue — uses centerX/bounds from closure in onDragMove. Needs testing.

### Files Reviewed
- TransformHandles.tsx — MODIFIED (the fix)
- geometry.ts — computeResize() is correct, no changes needed
- BoardPage.tsx — handleObjectResize at lines 291-309, TransformHandles rendered at 635-643
- intent-handler.ts — resize intent (line 158-161) is correct
- contracts.ts — resize intent type definition is correct
- useObjects.ts — resizeObject hook wrapper is correct

### How to Restore Testing Environment
1. cd /Users/jake/codebases/gauntlet/collabboard
2. bun run dev
3. Open in Chrome, sign in, open any board
4. Create object, select, drag corner handle to resize

### What to Do Next
1. Test multi-select resize (select 2+ objects, resize via handles)
2. Test rotation handle for similar stale-closure issue
3. Run bun run test to ensure no regressions
4. Consider adding integration tests for resize flow
5. Optional: separate preview from commit (onResize = local state, onResizeEnd = store commit)
6. Commit when all tests pass

### Current Git State
- Branch: main
- Modified: TransformHandles.tsx (the fix)
- NOT committed yet

title: Implement undo/redo with Cmd+Z and Cmd+Shift+Z
description: Add undo and redo functionality to the collaborative whiteboard. Cmd+Z (Mac) / Ctrl+Z (Windows/Linux) for undo, Cmd+Shift+Z / Ctrl+Shift+Z for redo. Maintain a command history stack tracking user actions (create, move, resize, rotate, delete, style changes, connector changes, frame operations). Undo reverses the most recent action and pushes it onto a redo stack. Redo re-applies the most recently undone action. The redo stack clears when a new action is performed after undoing. Scope undo/redo per-user in collaborative context.
